perturbation.original_text: Section 7.3 Payment. Except as otherwise specifically provided in this Agreement, all amounts due by one Party to the other under this Agreement, less any permitted deductions, shall be paid in full within sixty (60) days after the fiscal month in which such amounts were received by the paying Party, or the receipt by the paying Party of an invoice therefore, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 7.3 Payment. Except as otherwise specifically provided in this Agreement, all amounts due by one Party to the other under this Agreement, less any permitted deductions, shall be paid in full within ninety (90) days after the fiscal month in which such amounts were received by the paying Party, or the receipt by the paying Party of an invoice therefore, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires payment within 60 days, however, making it 90 days introduces a delay in payment that may contradict prompt payment laws in some states or specific industry regulations that mandate shorter payment periods.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state prompt payment laws.

perturbation.original_text: If either party wishes to extend the Initial Term it shall provide notice to the other not later than 180 days, nor sooner than 270 days, before the end of the Initial Term. The parties shall then engage in discussions regarding renewal for a period of 30 days. If no agreement is reached during that 30-day period, then neither party shall have any obligation to extend this Agreement beyond the Initial Term.
perturbation.changed_text: If either party wishes to extend the Initial Term it shall provide notice to the other not later than 30 days, nor sooner than 45 days, before the end of the Initial Term. The parties shall then engage in discussions regarding renewal for a period of 10 days. If no agreement is reached during that 10-day period, then neither party shall have any obligation to extend this Agreement beyond the Initial Term.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text significantly shortens the notification window for extending the contract, potentially violating requirements for reasonable notice periods, especially in franchise or long-term agreements where longer periods may be legally implied or required by industry standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of implied duties of good faith and fair dealing; potential conflict with franchise laws requiring reasonable notice.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding termination of this Agreement, each party shall pay to the other, within five (5) days after the effective date of such termination, any and all fees (including costs and expenses) owed hereunder as of such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding termination of this Agreement, each party shall pay to the other, within thirty (30) days after the effective date of such termination, any and all fees (including costs and expenses) owed hereunder as of such termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires payment within 5 days, however, changing it to 30 days after the termination effective date could violate state laws requiring immediate or very prompt payment of final wages or contract settlements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state wage and hour laws regarding final paycheck deadlines.
